channel.title: Ferguson Missouri on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Ferguson Missouri on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: No fly zone over Ferguson affects airport traffic at Lambert-St Louis Airport
item.description:
November 25, 2014, midnight. FAA has issued TFR affecting inbound flights. Airport is still open. Does not impact departures. — Lambert-STL Airport (@flystl) November 25, 2014 FAA TFR, NOTAM : 4/0271 Location : FERGUSON, MO, Tuesday, November 25, 2014 UTC. Not for navigation.
Flightstats shows that traffic is being diverted from the airport.
The FAA has issued a TFR over #Ferguson. But unlike last time, commercial flights are diverting away from @flystl.

item.title: FergusonCCM : Watching the Ferguson, MO City Council meeting of September 9, 2014
item.description: Some selected accounts here give some flavor of the meeting; I wasn't watching it end to end, but there was a lot of traffic on the Twitter octothorpe #FergusonCCM that was notable. New York Times: "Outrage and Calls for Change Follow Ferguson Officials Into Council Meeting" FERGUSON, Mo. — The first Ferguson City Council meeting since the police killing of Michael Brown one month ago erupted on Tuesday into an outpouring of grievances — accusations of racism, police harassment and government incompetence — as hundreds of residents made angry appeals for change.

item.title: Making sense of Ferguson, Missouri via the St Louis Localwiki
item.description: The St Louis, Missouri Localwiki - http://localwiki.net/st-louis - was mostly empty when the events in Ferguson, MO started on August 9, 2014 with the death of 18 year old student Michael Brown. As with any event where there's a lot that's going on in an unfamiliar area, I was drawn to making some sense of what was happening. This has been especially true when the coverage on the #ferguson hashtag overwhelmed my Twitter feed, which had been usually quiet at night.

item.title: August 13, 2014: Live feeds from Ferguson, MO
item.description: August 13, 2014: The events in Ferguson, Missouri continue to be tense. This is a developing situation. 2020 CST approx: LRAD noisemakers deployed. All live feeds appear to have gone down. Live on the scene with Twitter photos and Vine videos is Antonio French, a St Louis alderman; he's been there since the start and is a trusted local voice. Video feed, live: The Real Alex Jones. Jones is a 9/11 truther and a conspiracy theorist; as of 2035 CST his feed is broadcasting in front of the QT.

item.title: Listening to unrest in Ferguson, MO via Twitter, police and fire scanner, Hot 104.1, KTVI TV
item.description: August 10-11, 2014: It's a tense night in Ferguson, MO after last night's shooting of 18 year old Michael Brown. News account from the St Louis Post Dispatch, with photos: Violence breaks out near site of vigil for teen killed by police. FERGUSON • A day of protests and vigils Sunday for an unarmed black teenager who was shot to death by a Ferguson police officer erupted Sunday night with confrontations, looting and gunshots.

item.title: Ferguson, Missouri police shoot unarmed student Michael Brown, 18
item.description: Who: Michael Brown, age 18. What: Shot by Ferguson, Missouri police. When: Brown was walking, unarmed, at 2:15 p.m. on Saturday, August 19, 2014. Where: Ferguson, MO is 20 minutes northwest of St. Louis, MO. Why: Unknown. The unnamed officer has been put on paid leave, and the St. Louis County, MO Police will investigate. Media: KMOV 4, St Louis. Heavy police presence in Ferguson after fatal officer-involved shooting. According to Stark, there are at least 100 police cars and numerous officers armed with M-16's in the area.
